note.p: Mathematician and clergyman. Educated at King’s College, London, and Cambridge University. Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge, 1851; assistant tutor, 1851–3. Mathematics master at the City of London School, 1854. Mathematical lecturer, King’s College, London, 1857. Ordained priest, 1858. Mathematics master, Harrow School, 1857–65. A founder of the Alpine Club, 1857. Incumbent of the parish of Berkswell, near Coventry, 1865–1902. Published on mathematics and the kinetic theory of gases. A founder of the Birmingham Philosophical Society and president, 1880–1. FRS 1881.
